For Java you'll want either Emma:

http://www.eclemma.org/

Or Cobertura:

http://cobertura.sourceforge.net/

I personally use Emma for its Eclipse plugin and Cobertura for CI as it
gives more detailed statistics

On Wed, Jul 15, 2009 at 12:34 AM, Frank <afranka69@...> wrote:

>
>
> I'm new to JUnit. From what I have been able to find out so far it appears
> that JUnit can not report any kind of test coverage statistics against the
> source (for example statement or branch coverage). Is that true? If it is,
> do you know of a tool that does this for Java? There is such a tool for C++.
>
> Frank Ackerman
> Montana Tech
>
>  
>



-- 
To be honest, I really don't care which of you is wrong, just as long as
someone is, and I get to point it out
